children.value: . Besides, the custom machanism allows the users to design their own type of nodes by
. A node with complex graphics shapes, complex interactions, fantastic animations can be implemented easily.
In this document, we will introduce the custom enodeby five examples:
2. Register an edge by extending a built-in edge;
3. Register an edge with interactions and styles;
4. Register an edge with custom arrow;
Draw the graphics; Optimize the performance.
2. Register a node by extending a built-in node:
Add extra graphics shape; Add animation.
4. Register a node with state styles:
Response the states change by styles and animations
, there are two points should be satisfied when customize a node:
Controll the life cycle of the node;
Analyze the input data and show it by graphics.

/**

     * @param  {G.Group} group The container of the node
     * @return {G.Shape} The keyShape of the node. It can be obtained by node.get('keyShape')
     */

     * @param  {Object} cfg The configurations of the node

     */

/**
     * Update the node and its label
     * @override
     * @param  {Object} cfg The configurations of the node
     * @param  {Node} node The node item
     */

/**
     * The operations after updating the node. It is combined with afterDraw generally
     * @override
     * @param  {Object} cfg The configurations of the node
     * @param  {Node} node The node item
     */

/**
     * Response the node states change. Mainly the interaction states. The business states should be handled in the draw function
     * The states 'selected' and 'active' will be responsed on keyShape by default. To response more states, implement this function.

     * @param  {Object} value The value of the state
     * @param  {Node} node The node item

     * @param  {Object} cfg The configurations of the node

     */

properties.ariaLabel: 1 register a bran new node permalink

children.value: Now, we are going to register a diamond node:
Although there is a built-in diamond node in G6, we implement it here to rewrite it for demonstration.
From the following code, you will understand that the coordinates of the sub shapes of the custom node is related to itself, which means the

is also defined with the origin
. In the other words, users do not need to control the sub shapes' coordinates according to the nodes' coordinate which is controlled by the matrix of the parent group of the node.

properties.ariaLabel: 2 extend a built in node permalink

children.value: in G6. You can extend them to make some modification on them. It is similar to register the diamond node. single-node is the base class of all the node types, you can also extend it. (single-edge is the base class of all the edge types.)
For example, we are going to extend the single-node.

For more information about animation, please refer to
the intersection of the node and its related edges
(Left) The diamond node has no anchorPoints. (Right) The diamond node has anchorPoints.
There are two ways to adjust the anchorPoints of the node:
Assign different anchorPoints for different nodes.
Configure the anchorPoints globally for this type of node.

properties.ariaLabel: 4 register node with state styles permalink

children.value: In general, nodes and edges should response the states change by styles chaging. For example, highlight the node or edge clicked/hovered by user. We can achieve it by two ways:
Add a flag on the node data, control the style according to the flag in
Separate the interactive states from source data and
We recommend adjust the state styles by the second way, which can be achieved by:
Based on rect node, we extend a custom node with white filling. It will be turned to red when the mouse clicks it. Implement it by the code below:
// Find the first graphics shape of the node. It is determined by the order of being added
// Click to select, cancel by clicking again
G6 does not limit the states for nodes/edges, you can assign any states to a node once you response it in the
function. e.g. magnify the node by hovering:
// Find the first graphics shape of the node. It is determined by the order of being added
// Activate 'running' by mouse entering. Turn it of by mouse leaving.
SVG and DOM shape are not supported in V3.3.x.
Here, we demonstrate customing a node named
px; display: flex;">
type of node with DOM. Be attention that you should assign
for the shapes you added after V3.3, where
is an ununique string. The shape is allowed to be dragged when
DOM Shape in G6 does not support the events on Node and Edge. You can bind events for DOM as the way in HTML. e.g.:
<div onclick="alert('Hi')" style="background-color: #fff; border: 2px solid #5B8FF9; border-radius: 5px; width:
px; display: flex;">
